attributes.action: Make Greece sell an Island(s) to pay its debt.
attributes.additional_details:
When someone or something gets into huge debt it has to consider selling its assets. Why can’t Greece sell one or more of its many islands to help pay off their debt. I’m sure Germany would like to buy one or two and perhaps we could invest in one for Britain. This theory could also be taken forward in the brewing financial troubles of Italy and Spain.
Greece can't have its cake and eat it too, by expecting tax payers from other countries to just wright loans off. At the very least, its assets should be used as collateral for any further loans or bail outs.
